snippet: New measures intensify existing efforts to choke off Iran’s oil and shipping revenue. Officials said the measures were not tied to Mitt Romney’s suggestion of a tougher line on Iran.
abstract: Obama administration and Congress race to impose more punishing sanctions against Iran as its nuclear ambitions resurface in the presidential election campaign after Mitt Romney pledges to give Israel unstinting support in its confrontation with Iran; White House officials say new measures are unrelated to Romney's comments, but rather are meant to address Iran's circumvention of earlier sanctions.

byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and STEVEN LEE MYERS
byline.contributor: Jennifer Steinhauer and Jonathan Weisman contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: New measures intensify existing efforts to choke off Iran’s oil and shipping revenue. Officials said the measures were not tied to Mitt Romney’s suggestion of a tougher line on Iran.

headline.main: White House and Congress Are in Step Over Iran Sanctions
headline.print_headline: Obama and Congress in Step Over Iran Sanctions
